snippet: Bill de Blasio held a wide lead in the Democratic primary for New York City mayor. Joseph J. Lhota, the former Metropolitan Transportation Authority chief, won the Republican primary.
abstract: Bill de Blasio holds wide lead in Democratic primary for New York City mayor; it is yet unclear if he won the 40 percent needed to avoid runoff election with William C Thompson, who finished second; Joseph J Lhota wins Republican primary.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HALBFINGER and DAVID W. CHEN
byline.contributor: Allison Kopicki, Nate Schweber and Megan Thee-Brenan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Bill de Blasio held a wide lead in the Democratic primary for New York City mayor. Joseph J. Lhota, the former Metropolitan Transportation Authority chief, won the Republican primary.

headline.main: De Blasio First in Mayoral Primary; Unclear if He Avoids a Runoff
headline.print_headline: De Blasio First in Mayoral Primary; Near Total to Avoid a Runoff
